private_information: I have an intended symbolic plan consisting of ordered action tokens.
I can simulate action preconditions and effects at a propositional level for the objects referenced in my plan.
player.goal: Execute and simulate the planned steps and report resulting state transitions and unmet preconditions for the goal next object_8 object_6.

private_information: I watch and canonicalize identifiers and synonyms across agent reports.
I map object labels to a consistent canonical naming scheme and list all predicates referenced.
observer.goal: Produce a canonical object and predicate mapping and a compact summary of public facts so other agents have consistent references.

private_information: I specialize in temporal and causal consistency checking.
I detect and remove bookkeeping shortcuts, quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, and any ad hoc repairs in reported plans.
auditor.goal: Audit reported plans and state traces for temporal and causal soundness, flag cyclic dependencies or impossible effects, and propose minimal-safe corrections.

private_information: I integrate analysis, canonicalization, and audit outputs and produce the final planning artifacts.
I know the target solver is FastDownwards and will ensure produced PDDL is compatible.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent outputs and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner to achieve next object_8 object_6.

public_information: There are named objects object_0 through object_8 that participate in predicates and actions.
Available actions and their informal schemas are paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted.
paltry requires hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, and next object_1 object_2; paltry makes next object_0 object_2 true and vase object_0 object_1 false.
sip requires hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, and next object_1 object_2; sip makes vase object_0 object_1 true and next object_0 object_2 false.
clip requires hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, and next object_0 object_2; clip makes vase object_0 object_1 true and next object_0 object_2 false.

wretched requires sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, and collect object_2 object_3; wretched makes next object_0 object_2 true and next object_0 object_1 false.
memory requires cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, and next object_0 object_1; memory makes next object_0 object_2 true and next object_0 object_1 false.

tightfisted requires hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, and vase object_0 object_1; tightfisted makes next object_0 object_2 true and vase object_0 object_1 false.
Two initial statement variants exist in the scenario and both challenge object index relationships and initial next predicates.
The ultimate goal for the scenario is to achieve the atom next object_8 object_6.

analyze.system_prompt: You are the player agent responsible for interpreting the human-provided plan and simulating its application at a symbolic level. Do not emit PDDL. Work at the level of predicates and objects. For each plan step produce a concise state delta: list satisfied preconditions, list missing preconditions, list effects applied, and the resulting state changes. If you must assume missing information, state the minimal assumption explicitly. Report the final truth of the goal atom next object_8 object_6 after the simulated sequence. Use the public information and your private plan knowledge as context.
analyze.prompt: Your name is player. You have the following public information available: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->player->private_information}. Your objective is: {agents->player->goal}. Here is the human plan to simulate: memory object_1 object_6 object_7; sip object_8 object_1 object_7; memory object_1 object_7 object_6; paltry object_8 object_1 object_6. Think step by step and produce a symbolic trace, listing per-step preconditions met or unmet, applied effects, and the resulting set of ground atoms after each step.

summarize.system_prompt: You are an observer whose role is canonicalization. Do not emit PDDL. Build a canonical mapping of object identifiers and predicate names, normalize synonyms and ambiguous references, and produce a compact list of all predicate instances present in the public information and the plan. Also provide a glossary that maps any ambiguous or shorthand labels to the canonical form to be used by other agents.
summarize.prompt: Your name is observer. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->observer->private_information}. Your goal is: {agents->observer->goal}. Produce a canonical object list for object_0 through object_8, a canonical predicate inventory for cats, hand, texture, vase, next, collect, sneeze, spring, stupendous and any action schema names, and a normalized list of initial ground atoms derived from the scenario variants.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor focused on temporal and causal consistency. Do not emit PDDL. Your task is to inspect simulated traces and canonicalized mappings, identify cycles, impossible effect chains, bookkeeping shortcuts such as ad hoc counters or post-hoc repairs, and propose minimal, explicit corrections or re-orderings that restore causal validity while preserving the intent of the plan. Provide a corrected sequence or state insertions that are necessary to make the plan executable without introducing synthetic bookkeeping tokens.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->auditor->private_information}. Your goal is: {agents->auditor->goal}. Use the player's simulated trace {analysis_player} and the observer's canonicalization {summary_observer} to produce an audit report. Identify any step that relies on illicit bookkeeping shortcuts or on effects that appear post-hoc. Propose minimal changes to ordering or explicit required facts to restore causal soundness. Mark any unresolved ambiguities.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems and the FastDownwards planner. Your job is to integrate analysis, canonicalization, and audit reports and produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that FastDownwards can accept. Keep agent actions distinct by namespacing action names where appropriate. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure types, objects, initial state, and goal are all consistent with the canonical mapping. Resolve ambiguities only when justified by auditor recommendations, and document any assumptions you make in short comments inside the PDDL problem file as plain textual comments.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. The global goal to achieve is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Here are the inputs you must integrate: the player's simulation {analysis_player}, the observer's canonicalization {summary_observer}, and the auditor's corrections {audit_auditor}. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting FastDownwards that encode the available actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted with their preconditions and effects as described in the public information. Keep action names distinct and preserve agent intention while ensuring causal and temporal soundness. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
